intro: Cyrtandra tripla, commonly known as the three-lobed heliconia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Heliconiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored inflorescences. The plant features large, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that attract various pollinators. Cyrtandra tripla is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
